citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Significant accumulations of parakeet feces was present on the tops of several shelter boxes maintained within the
enclosure. Some of the tops were completely covered with feces. Feces must be removed to prevent such accumulations
and to reduce disease hazards.
Excreta and food waste must be removed from primary enclosures and from under and around primary enclosures as
often as necessary to prevent excessive accumulation of feces and food waste, to prevent soiling of the birds contained in
the primary enclosures, and to reduce disease hazards, insects, pests, and odors.
TO BE CORRECTED BY: DECEMBER 8, 2023
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
JESSICA GOWINS, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.158(a)(1) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
Significant accumulations of parakeet feces was present on the tops of several shelter boxes maintained within the 
enclosure. Some of the tops were completely covered with feces. Feces must be removed to prevent such accumulations 
and to reduce disease hazards. 
 
Excreta and food waste must be removed from primary enclosures and from under and around primary enclosures as 
often as necessary to prevent excessive accumulation of feces and food waste, to prevent soiling of the birds contained in 
the primary enclosures, and to reduce disease hazards, insects, pests, and odors.  
 
TO BE CORRECTED BY: DECEMBER 8, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
JESSICA GOWINS, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
